cte_events.description: Dive into the GMA Series at Texas A&M, a cluster of enriching academic webinars designed to foster valuable skills, such as effective communication, aligning expectations, and promoting professional development. These enlightening virtual sessions offer practical insights to enhance your working relationships and career growth. Join us and empower your professional journey!

events.event_name: GMA | Promoting Professional Development | Monday, July 7, 10:00-11:30 Am | Virtual
GMA | Maintaining Effective Communication | Wednesday, July 9, 2:00-4:00 Pm | Virtual
GMA | Fostering Independence | Tuesday, July 15, 12:00-1:30 Pm | Virtual
GMA | Aligning Expectations | Thursday, July 17, 9:00-10:30 Am | Virtual

cte_events.description: Dive into the future of education at Texas A&M's Digital Learning Expo series! This exciting academic event, both in-person and virtual, offers faculty and staff an exclusive opportunity to explore the latest trends in digital teaching methods. Join us to enhance your teaching skills and provide an enriched learning experience for your students. Don't miss out, register today!

events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Join our interactive Digital Learning Expo for a deep dive into the latest trends in digital learning. Explore topics such as digital accessibility, generative AI, third-party tools, new analytics, and frequently requested Canvas subjects. You'll walk away with practical strategies for various educational contexts and an understanding of the impact of current digital learning trends. Collaborative sessions will also facilitate peer-integrated learning strategies.

events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
Reem Hussein, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
Jobin Varughese, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Sueli Rocha-Rojas, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Join us for an engaging series of workshops at the Digital Learning Expo, where you'll explore the latest trends and innovations in digital learning such as Accessibility, Generative AI, Third Party tools, New analytics, and Canvas topics. Gain practical strategies for diverse educational contexts and collaborate with peers to integrate these strategies, enhancing your digital teaching effectiveness.

cte_events.description: "Unlock the potential of digital learning at our Additional Events series at Texas A&M University. Dive into the world of digital accessibility, create accessible content, and unravel the mysteries of Generative AI in higher education. Benefit from these enriching sessions to ensure an inclusive, innovative, and efficient learning environment. Join us and empower your educational journey!"

events.event_name: Empower And Engage: High-Impact Teaching For Student Success
events.event_facilitators: Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Engage in an active session aimed at transforming teaching practices to boost student success. Learn about high-impact strategies such as community-engaged learning, collaborative projects, writing-intensive courses, and capstone seminars. Gain practical tools and actionable strategies to improve course design, stimulate student engagement, and promote academic excellence, ultimately fostering meaningful learning experiences that unlock student potential.

events.event_name: Connecting Classrooms And Communities: An Introduction To Community-Engaged Learning
events.event_facilitators:
Dr. Nate Poling, Center for Teaching Excellence
Register Here: Join us for an engaging interactive session designed to introduce faculty to the transformative practices of community-engaged learning. As our institution launches a new initiative focused on service and citizenship, this workshop will explore how instructional approaches that integrate civic engagement, community involvement, academic performance, and professional skills can enrich the undergraduate educational experience.
Participants will gain an insightful overview of these practices, discover practical strategies for incorporating them into their course design, and learn how to enhance student engagement and success. Whether you’re new to these concepts or looking to innovate your teaching methods, this session offers valuable insights and tools to make a lasting impact on your students’ learning journey.
Learning Outcomes: Participants will be able to…
1) Describe community-engaged learning and how it can both promote student success and have positive community impact.

Register Here: https://ers.tamu.edu/register.aspx?scheduleid=44799

cte_events.description: "Unlock the power of inclusivity with the Digital Accessibility Series at Texas A&M University! Deepen your understanding of the importance and impact of digital accessibility on student learning, and learn how to create universally accessible content. Don't miss this opportunity to ensure digital equality in your classroom, sign up today and make a difference!"

events.event_name: Digital Accessibility Series – Session 3: Improving Accessibility Of PDF Files
events.event_facilitators:
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Jamie Thompson, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: This session, part of the Digital Accessibility Series, delves into the complexities of PDF remediation in adherence to the recent Title II revision. Participants will explore typical accessibility issues in PDF files and gain hands-on experience with Adobe Acrobat’s built-in accessibility checker.

cte_events.description: "Jumpstart your educational journey with our Course Design Series at Texas A&M University. Dive into the complexities of curriculum design, explore innovative tools, and learn to craft compelling learning outcomes. Enhance your teaching prowess and cultivate engaging, well-aligned courses. Don't miss this chance - elevate your educational impact today!"

events.event_name: Course Design Series: Session 1 - Crafting Learning Outcomes, The Foundation Of A Course
events.event_facilitators:
Jean Layne, Center for Teaching Excellence
Carlos Perez, Center for Teaching Excellence
Dr. Armanto Sutedjo, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Delve into course design cycle essentials and the significance of well-aligned learning outcomes. Engage with supportive tools for outcome creation and revision, tailored to your course context. Practice writing and revising learning outcomes, with opportunities for feedback. Explore strategies to share learning outcomes with students and commence developing your course alignment map.

elp_events.description: "Unlock the potential of digital learning at our Additional Events series at Texas A&M University. Dive into the world of digital accessibility, create accessible content, and unravel the mysteries of Generative AI in higher education. Benefit from these enriching sessions to ensure an inclusive, innovative, and efficient learning environment. Join us and empower your educational journey!"

events.event_name: Live Workshop In The Virtual Language Lab For English Proficiency
events.event_facilitators: Ginessa Payne, Center for Teaching Excellence
events.event_description: Enhance your pronunciation and listening abilities with the cost-free CTE-ELP Virtual Language Lab. This live, interactive workshop is aimed at individuals who speak English as a Second Language (ESL). Participants will engage with a range of exercises within the lab, fostering familiarity and independence in utilizing this resource. The focus is on practical usage, voice typing activation, and interactive quiz response.

weekly_events.description: Dive into our Microteaching Practice series at Texas A&M University, designed to cultivate your teaching prowess and public speaking finesse. Each week, you'll deliver a micro-lecture in a supportive environment, honing your skills while receiving invaluable feedback. Witness your confidence grow as an educator and communicator, with the guidance of our experienced consultants and engaged undergraduate students. Don't miss this opportunity to elevate your professional abilities. Join us and discover the transformative power of focused, sustained practice!
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: The Microteaching Practice series, focusing on English Language Proficiency, is held virtually every Monday and Wednesday from 8:30am - 9:30am and 10:00am - 11:00am CDT, respectively. Facilitators include Ginessa Payne and Michele Vick from the Center for Teaching Excellence.

weekly_events.category_name: ELP Journal Club: A Conversation Circle For Text-Based Discussions
weekly_events.description: Dive into enriching text-based discussions at our ELP Journal Club, an academic event series tailored for international faculty and TAs at Texas A&M University. Each week, you'll gain confidence as you prepare, read, and lead discussions on selected articles. This engaging platform not only refines your presentation skills but also fosters a deeper understanding of diverse academic texts. Don't miss the chance to enhance your academic discourse skills and broaden your intellectual horizons. Sign up today for a transformative experience!
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: The ELP Journal Club is virtually held every Monday from 11:00am to 12:00pm CDT, facilitated by Michele Vick from the Center for Teaching Excellence.

weekly_events.category_name: Conversation Circle For English Language Proficiency
weekly_events.description: "Join our Conversation Circle series, an engaging platform designed to enhance your English language proficiency through lively and cultural discussions. This weekly event provides a supportive environment to cultivate spontaneous speaking, active listening, and conversational turn-taking skills. Grasp the nuances of American university culture, and evolve your communication prowess interacting with varied speakers. Faculty and staff, amplify your English articulation and comprehension in this enriching journey. Don't miss this unique opportunity to broaden your horizons!"
weekly_events.weekly_event_info: The "Conversation Circle For English Language Proficiency" sessions are held virtually on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 8:00am - 9:00am CDT, and in person at BLOCKER 236 A on Wednesdays from 1:00pm - 2:00pm CDT. They are facilitated by Michele Vick and Sarah Vargas from the Center for Teaching Excellence.
